mainview.commandBarPlaceholder: search by keywords or type '\' for commands
mainview.title: Title

smartfilter.filter: Query Sentence (You can directly write a query sentence in the input box, or use the following form to generate a query sentence.)
smartfilter.name: Name

preference.storagefolderintro: Choose a folder to store paper files (e.g., PDF etc.) and the database files.
preference.sourcefileoprationintro: Copy/Cut/Link the source file of the imported papers to the Paperlib folder. (Symlink is not available with the WebDAV storage backend. and is required to turn on the Developer Mode in the system settings to use Symlink on Windows.)
preference.colorthemeintro: Choose a theme for Paperlib UI.
preference.invertpreviewcolorintro: Invert PDF preview colors in the detail panel if the current theme is Dark.
preference.openpdfwithintro: Use viewer to open PDF files:
preference.displaycountnumberintro: Show the count badges in the sidebar.
preference.compactsidebarintro: Reduce the line height of the sidebar item.
preference.sortbyintro: Sort tags and folders in the sidebar by.
preference.sortorderintro: The order of sorting tags and folders in the sidebar.
preference.name: Name
preference.presetintro: Choose a preset scraper rule according to your research topic. Paperlib will scraper metadata in order. Any contributions are welcome in the Github issue.
preference.enableroutionscrapeintro: Automatically rescrape the metadata of the preprint version papers, e.g., arXiv, every week.
preference.filestoragebackendintro: Choose a backend to store the paper files such as PDF files.
preference.flexibleSyncIntro: Currentlly, MongoDB Atlas doesn't support the partition based sync Paperlib used before anymore. For new users who want to use the cloud sync, please turn on this.
preference.migrateintro: Migrate local database to cloud. This will merge the existing local database with the one on the cloud.
preference.importfromafolderintro: Choose a folder to import all PDF paper files inside there.
preference.importfromzoterointro: Choose a CSV file exported from Zotero. To export it, click File - Export Library - Format: CSV - Encoding: UTF-8 in the Zotero app.
preference.cslstyleintro: Choose a CSL style for the plaintext reference.
preference.exportreplacementintro: Enable replacing the publication with a customed string when exporting a paper. For example, replacing 'Conference on Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition' by 'CVPR'.
preference.pleaserestart: Please restart Paperlib to take effect.
preference.allowproxyintro: Enable proxy to access the web source. Paperlib will use the system proxy settings by default. Or you can set a custom proxy. If you are in some regions such as China mainland, you can try to set a proxy to accelarate the web connection.
preference.mswordaddinintro: Install the Microsoft Word Add-in to insert citations and bibliographies in Word.
preference.exportcsvintro: Export the entire library to a CSV file.
preference.fontsizeintro: The font size of the UI.
preference.mainviewshortauthor: Use et al. for long author list.
preference.hotkeysInvalidSingleKeyInfo: Only Enter, Space, Delete or F1-F12 can be used as a single key.
preference.hotkeysInvalidMultipleKeysInfo: Only shortcuts that start with (Ctrl or Cmd) or (Control or Command) + (Alt or Shift or Command) are valid.
preference.hotkeysDuplicateKeysInfo: This shortcut is already used by another shortcut.

presetting.cloudintro: If you wish to use the cloud sync, please setup it later in the preference panel.
presetting.scraperintrosub: Paperlib retrive your paper's metadata from online databases. Please go to the extension preference view to setup them. Choosing a suitable scraper combination can improve matching accuracy and reduce query time.
presetting.extensionintro: We recommand you to install the following extensions to improve your experience. All metadata scrapers are provided by the extensions in 3.0 version.

guide.import1info1: Drag and drop your PDF files here to import them.
guide.import1info2: You can also download our browser extension to import PDFs directly from the web.
guide.import2info1: Drag and drop your PDF files to a tag/folder to import them directly to it.
guide.supp1info1: Drag and drop your files here to add them as supplementary files.
guide.supp1info2: Right click on a file to delete or rename it.
guide.search1info1: You can search your library using the search bar.
guide.search1info2: By pressing '\', you can open the command bar to do fulltext or advanced searching, and also perform various actions.
guide.viewmode1info1: You can switch between list view, table view, and table reader view.
guide.viewmode1info2: In the preference view - mainview tab, you can choose which information to display in each view mode.
guide.quickpaste1info1: By pressing `Ctrl/Cmd + Shift + I`, you can open the quick copy-paste window to copy and paste references.
guide.quickpaste1info2: It's a convenient way to copy BibTex, or plain text references to your clipboard when you are writing a paper.
guide.more1info1: Please visit our website for more guides and tutorials.
